Rationals

Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rationals.Rational

  • public class Rational
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of this class is used to represent a Rational number.
    Author:
    (@zshulu) Bruno Farjallah

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rational

        public Rational(int p,
        int q)
         throws ConstructionException
        Creates a new Rational number.

        This constructor creates a Rational number with the following attributes.

        Parameters:
        p - - the numerator
        q - - the denominator
        Throws:
        ConstructionException - if denominator has a zero value
        See Also:
        ConstructionException}

      • Rational

        public Rational(int n)
         throws ConstructionException
        Creates a new Rational number. (More specifically a relative integer)

        This constructor creates a Rational number, that has 1 as denominator. Therefore it creates an integer.

        Parameters:
        n - - the value of the number
        Throws:
        ConstructionException - - if denominator has a zero value
        See Also:
        ConstructionException}

      • Rational

        public Rational()
         throws ConstructionException
        Creates a new Zeroed Rational number.

        This constructor creates a Zero value Rational number.

        Throws:
        ConstructionException - if denominator has a zero value
        See Also:
        ConstructionException}

      • reduce

        public void reduce()
        Reduces the Rational number.

      • invert

        public void invert()
            throws ConstructionException
        Inverts the Rational number.

        If the Rational number is p/q, it becomes q/p.

        Throws:
        ConstructionException - if numerator is zero
        See Also:
        ConstructionException}

      • negate

        public void negate()
        Negates a Rational number.

        If the Rational number is p/q, it becomes -p/q.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Overrides java.lang.Object.equals(Object).

        Checks that two Rational numbers are identical.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - - Object
        Returns:
        true if invoking Rational is identical to o
